gi.title: alt text
gi.p: A text description of an image or other visual content. Its purpose is to describe content to readers who are unable to see the page.

gi.title: AMSMath
gi.p: A package containing a wide variety of common math symbols.

gi.title: Asymptote
gi.p: A package for drawing graphs, diagrams or pictures which may be used with or .

gi.title: attribute
gi.p: In XML, tags can have attributes, which provide more information about the element. For example, in <section permid="dWf"> the tag is section, the attribute is permid, and the value of that attribute is dWf.

gi.title: BibTeX
gi.p: A package for typesetting bibliographies.

gi.title: branch
gi.p: In git, the files in a repository can exist in multiple versions which are independent of each other, but are able to be merged. Each independent version is a branch

gi.title: commit
gi.p: In git, the act of declaring that changes to the files in a branch are now a permanent part of that branch.

gi.title: copyleft
gi.p: An arrangement whereby software or artistic work may be used, modified, and distributed freely on condition that anything derived from it is bound by the same condition.

gi.title: Creative Commons
gi.p: An organization which has created several open licenses for creative works.

The Creative Commons licenses are: CC BY, CC BY-SA, CC BY-ND, CC BY-NC, CC BY-NC-SA, and CC BY-NC-ND. The strings BY, SA, ND, and NC represent, respectively, Attribution, Share Alike, No Derivatives, and Noncommercial.

gi.title: D3.js
gi.p: A JavaScript library for animating data. The name comes from Data Driven Documents.

gi.title: Desmos
gi.p: A graphing calculator that can be embedded in a Web page.

gi.title: division
gi.p: In , a part, chapter, section, subsection, subsubsection, appendix, or paragraphs of a document, other similar components such as readingquestions, exercises, or glossary, as well as various similar content markup outside the main content.

gi.title: DVI
gi.p: A file format intermediate between and PS or PDF. Stands for Device Independent.

gi.title: EPS
gi.p: Encapsulated Postscript: a form of Postscript designed to hold a fragment of a page, to be included in a larger document.

gi.title: escape character
gi.p: Every markup language has escape characters which play a special role. In XML there are two escape characters: & and <. In there are 10 escape characters: # $ % & \ ^ _ { } and ~.

gi.title: FontAwesome
gi.p: A package containing many popular icons.

gi.title: GeoGebra
gi.p: An interactive environment particularly suited for constructing demonstrations in Euclidean geometry.

gi.title: GFDL
gi.p: GNU Free Documentation License: a copyleft license for manuals, textbooks, and other written materials.

gi.title: GIF
gi.p: Graphics Interchange Format: a lossless bitmap image format.

gi.title: git
gi.p: A version control system which is is used to track changes to computer files. Git is particularly useful for large projects involving multiple authors.

gi.title: GitHub
gi.p: A commercial website which hosts repositories for software projects, with the assumption that users use git to transfer material between GitHub and other systems.

gi.title: GPL
gi.p: GNU General Public License: a copyleft license which gives users the right to run, study, share and modify software.

gi.title: HTML
gi.p: Hypertext Markup Language: the markup language used to describe the content of Web pages.

gi.title: JavaScript
gi.p: A computer language in common use for interactivity in Web pages.

gi.title: JPEG
gi.p: A method for compressing digital images, where the amount of compression can be adjusted, allowing for a tradeoff between image size and image quality. Named for the Joint Photographic Experts Group, which developed the standard. Files with JPEG compression usually have the extension .jpg.

gi.title: Jupyter
gi.p: An interactive computing environment designed to support a wide variety of computer languages. Named after the languages Julia, Python and R.
A Jupyter notebook is a Web-based environment running Jupyter, typically accessed through a browser.

gi.title: JSXGraph
gi.p: A JavaScript library for interactive geometry, function plotting, and data visualization.

gi.title: knowl
gi.p: Similar to a hyperlink, except the referenced material appears inside the current Web page. Usually indicated by a dotted underline.
Pronounced knoll as in a knoll is a small hill.
A markup language used for books and papers with lots of mathematics, which is built on . uses as an intermediate format to produce PDF and print output.

gi.title: main branch
gi.p: In git, the name of the default branch.

gi.title: Markdown
gi.p: A plain text markup language which is easy to use, is limited in its capabilities (compared to or , for example), but can convert to many other formats.

gi.title: markup language
gi.p: A computer language that uses tags to define the content of a document. XML, HTML, Markdown, and are examples of markup languages.

gi.title: master branch
gi.p: In git, the former name of the default branch. Currently main is the preferred.

gi.title: MathJax
gi.p: A JavaScript package for converting math to presentation MathML or other visual formats.

gi.title: MBX
gi.p: was once known as MathBook XML, commonly abbreviated as MBX. This abbreviation appears in many historical references.

gi.title: MP3
gi.p: A format for storing audio content.

gi.title: MP4
gi.p: A format for storing video content.

gi.title: MyOpenMath
gi.p: A free and open online homework system.

gi.title: Ogg
gi.p: A format for storing video content.

gi.title: origin repository
gi.p: In git, the default name for the remote repository from which the local repository was cloned.

gi.title: PDF
gi.p: Portable Document Format: a file format designed for printing documents, where the appearance of the pages is identical on all devices.

gi.title: PDFLaTeX
gi.p: One of the available programs to convert to PDF.

gi.title: pgfplots
gi.p: A package for drawing graphs of functions.

gi.title: PNG
gi.p: Portable Network Graphics: a raster image format that supports lossless data compression. PNG offers a similar functionality to GIF but is not subject to patent protection.

gi.title: Postscript
gi.p: A page description language and file format designed for printing documents.
The markup language and document preparation system for creating the next generation of textbooks. And the generation after that.

gi.title: PSTricks
gi.p: A package for drawing diagrams and pictures.

gi.title: pull
gi.p: In git, the process of transferring information from a remote repository to a local repository.

gi.title: pull request
gi.p: In git, a suggestion that the changes to the files in one branch be merged into another branch (typically in another repository).

gi.title: push
gi.p: In git, the process of transferring information from a local repository to a remote repository.

gi.title: Python
gi.p: A general-purpose programming language, noted for making it easy (compared to other programming languages) for a programmer to read the code written by someone else. Sage is written in Python.

gi.title: QR code
gi.p: Quick Response code: a type of two-dimensional bar code, usually consisting of a grid of small black-and-white squares.

gi.title: R
gi.p: A programming language and software environment for statistics; available in Sage.

gi.title: Sage
gi.p: An open source computer algebra system for a wide range of symbolic and numerical mathematical computations.

gi.title: Sage cell
gi.p: A text box in which the user can run Sage commands, designed to be included in a Web page.

gi.title: Sage interact
gi.p: A interactive demonstration, with sliders and boxes to adjust parameters, created as a single Python function in Sage.

gi.title: siunitx
gi.p: A package for typesetting scientific units.

gi.title: SVG
gi.p: Scalable Vector Graphics: an XML vector image format for two-dimensional graphics.

gi.title: tag
gi.p: In XML, tags are enclosed in angle brackets and are used to describe the contents of a document. For example, if All about even was the title of a book about numbers that are multiples of 2, then the XML source of that book might mark up the title using the title tag, as <title>All about even</title>. In XML, most tags occur in pairs which surround their content, with the closing tag beginning with a slash /. However, some tags which do not contain content are are self-closing, meaning that they end with a slash, such as <mdash/> and <pretext/>.
A typesetting language with high-quality automatic line- and page-breaking, specifically designed for mathematics.

gi.title: three.js
gi.p: A JavaScript library for animating 3-dimensional graphics on a Web page.

gi.title: TikZ
gi.p: A package for drawing diagrams and pictures.

gi.title: unicode
gi.p: The accepted standard for encoding text in any language.

gi.title: upstream repository
gi.p: In git, the usual name for the remote repository from which the local repository was originally forked.

gi.title: URL
gi.p: Uniform Resource Locator: the web address of a Web page (or other online content) consisting of a domain name, optionally followed by strings separated by slashes (/) which indicate specific content in the domain.

gi.title: Vimeo
gi.p: A commercial website for hosting videos.

gi.title: WebM
gi.p: A format for storing video content.
An open-source online homework system for math and sciences courses.

gi.title: Wolfram CDF
gi.p: Wolfram Computable Document Format: a system for creating interactive demonstrations hosted in the Wolfram Cloud.
One of the available programs to convert to DVI or PDF, the executable is xelatex.

gi.title: XML
gi.p: eXstensible Markup Language: the base syntax for the language. Angle brackets enclose matching begin and end tags. Tags can nest hierarchically, and can have attributes. HTML is another markup language that uses XML syntax.

gi.title: XSL
gi.p: eXstensible Stylesheet Language: the language that describes how to convert XML to other formats. 's XSL stylesheets are used to convert XML to , HTML, ePub, and other formats.

gi.title: xsltproc
gi.p: A command-line program which takes as input an XSL file and and XML file, using the contents of the XSL file to transform the contents of the XML file. It is now preferred to use the CLI for transforming.

gi.title: xypic
gi.p: A package for drawing simple commutative diagrams.

gi.title: YouTube
gi.p: A commercial website for hosting videos.
